summary:
Bo de Jong (The Netherlands 1964)(curriculum vitae)

From 1982 to 1987 Bo studied at the Royal Academy of Arts  She works in painting, drawing, printing and photography.

She is given a starters stipend of the Fonds van Beeldende Kunst (Foundation of Arts) in Amsterdam in 1989, 1994 and 1996. From 1990 to 1993 she gets various other stipends from the Foundation of Arts.

From 1990 to 1997 she is part of the selection committee for the art library of Zoetermeer.
Starting in 1990 Bo makes several journeys to South America. There she makes photo reports about “Tango” in Buenos Aires and about the culture of the natives of the Andes (Ecuador, Argentina and Bolivia).
She has several expositions in Ecuador and Argentina where she also makes wall paintings.
During her stay in Ecuador in 1996 she teaches drawing and painting at a number of primary schools in the Andes.
In 2001 Bo initiates and manages the project “Sarah and Maria” an art project about fairy tales for children in Zeeland (The Netherlands) and North Argentina. For this project Bo travels to Argentina in 2001 where she teaches children at rural schools.

Since 1999 she teaches drawing and painting at the centre for art education in Flushing.
Since 2005 she lives in Middelburg (The Netherlands) where she teaches art to children and teachers at primary schools.
In 1999 she becomes interested in the digital world. She studies digital photography and works in Photoshop. She writes books and programmes for primary and secondary education e.g. the books Het Nachtpaard (The Night Horse) and Alles Beweegt (Everything Moves).
From 1999 to 2003 Bo is a member of the Culture Council of the province Zeeland.
Bo is a qualified teacher and works at 14 different primary schools.

Since 2008 she is specialised in portraits but she also made paintings after a trip to Egypt.

treasury_media.title: donkerboskl
treasury_media.description: She also made trips to Marokko and Turkey. Now she is making painting of landscapes and portraits
